radiographic_examinations.findings: Radiographs demonstrated a femoral nonunion, varus collapse, and implant failure.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: At eighteen months postoperatively, the fracture appeared healed radiographically.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Radiographs demonstrated a nonunion with failure of the plate in the distal femoral metaphysis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Eighteen months postoperatively, the fracture appeared healed radiographically.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Plain radiographs demonstrated some healing bilaterally.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Six months after surgery, plain radiographs demonstrated 5° of varus deformity of the distal part of the right femur with further evidence of metaphyseal healing.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Plain radiographs demonstrated breakage of two locked screws at the screw-plate interface and lateral displacement of another screw.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Sixteen months after the surgery, the fracture appeared united with a loss of 5° of angular alignment.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Radiographs demonstrated some healing of the distal femoral fractures with stable alignment.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Six months postoperatively, radiographs showed two screws that were broken at the distal screw-plate interface and 5° of varus collapse.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Radiographs showed two screws that were broken at the distal screw-plate interface and four distal screws backing out.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Twenty months later, the fracture was healed, function had improved, and knee flexion was from 0° to 110°.
